title: Gunatraya Vibhaga Yoga
subtitle: The Yoga of the Division of the Three Gunas
summary: In Chapter 14, Lord Krishna explains the three Gunas (modes of material nature) – Sattva (goodness), Rajas (passion), and Tamas (ignorance). He describes how these Gunas bind the soul to the body, influence human behavior, and how one can transcend them through devotion and detachment to attain liberation (moksha).

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | परं भूयः प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम् | यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनयः सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गताः ||
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | paraṁ bhūyaḥ pravakṣyāmi jñānānāṁ jñānam uttamam | yaj jñātvā munayaḥ sarve parāṁ siddhim ito gatāḥ ||
verses.translation: The Blessed Lord said: I shall again declare to you this supreme wisdom, the best of all knowledge, knowing which all the sages have attained the highest perfection.
verses.explanation: Krishna introduces this chapter as a continuation of divine knowledge, declaring it the highest wisdom that leads sages to liberation.

verses.sanskrit: इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागताः | सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च ||
verses.transliteration: idaṁ jñānam upāśritya mama sādharmyam āgatāḥ | sarge 'pi nopajāyante pralaye na vyathanti ca ||
verses.translation: By taking refuge in this knowledge, one attains My divine nature; such persons are neither born at the time of creation nor disturbed at the time of dissolution.
verses.explanation: Those who embody this wisdom become like Krishna—free from rebirth and unaffected by cosmic cycles.

verses.sanskrit: मम योनिर्महद्ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम् | सम्भवः सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत ||
verses.transliteration: mama yonir mahad brahma tasmin garbhaṁ dadhāmy aham | sambhavaḥ sarva-bhūtānāṁ tato bhavati bhārata ||
verses.translation: My womb is the great Brahman (Prakriti); in that I place the seed (of consciousness). From this arises the birth of all beings, O Bharata.
verses.explanation: Krishna describes Prakriti (material nature) as the womb and Himself as the seed-giving father of all creation.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तयः सम्भवन्ति याः | तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रदः पिता ||
verses.transliteration: sarva-yoniṣu kaunteya mūrtayaḥ sambhavanti yāḥ | tāsāṁ brahma mahad yonir ahaṁ bīja-pradaḥ pitā ||
verses.translation: Whatever forms are produced in all wombs, O Arjuna, the great Brahman (Prakriti) is their womb, and I am the seed-giving father.
verses.explanation: Reiterating that all life forms emerge from the union of Prakriti (nature) and Purusha (Krishna as the Supreme Consciousness).

verses.sanskrit: सत्त्वं रजस्तम इति गुणाः प्रकृतिसम्भवाः | निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम् ||
verses.transliteration: sattvaṁ rajas tama iti guṇāḥ prakṛti-sambhavāḥ | nibadhnanti mahā-bāho dehe dehinam avyayam ||
verses.translation: The three Gunas—Sattva (goodness), Rajas (passion), and Tamas (ignorance)—born of Prakriti, bind the imperishable soul to the body, O mighty-armed Arjuna.
verses.explanation: Krishna introduces the three Gunas as the forces that bind the eternal soul to the material body.

verses.sanskrit: तत्र सत्त्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम् | सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ ||
verses.transliteration: tatra sattvaṁ nirmalatvāt prakāśakam anāmayam | sukha-saṅgena badhnāti jñāna-saṅgena cānagha ||
verses.translation: Among these, Sattva, being pure, is luminous and free from sin. It binds by attachment to happiness and knowledge, O sinless one.
verses.explanation: Sattva Guna is pure and illuminating but still binds the soul through attachment to happiness and wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम् | तन्निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम् ||
verses.transliteration: rajo rāgātmakaṁ viddhi tṛṣṇā-saṅga-samudbhavam | tan nibadhnāti kaunteya karma-saṅgena dehinam ||
verses.translation: Know Rajas to be of the nature of passion, arising from thirst and attachment. It binds the soul through attachment to action, O Arjuna.
verses.explanation: Rajas Guna fuels desire and attachment, binding the soul through relentless activity.

verses.sanskrit: तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम् | प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्नाति भारत ||
verses.transliteration: tamas tv ajñāna-jaṁ viddhi mohanaṁ sarva-dehinām | pramādālasya-nidrābhis tan nibadhnāti bhārata ||
verses.translation: Know Tamas to be born of ignorance, deluding all beings. It binds through negligence, laziness, and sleep, O Bharata.
verses.explanation: Tamas Guna arises from ignorance and binds the soul through delusion, inertia, and lethargy.

verses.sanskrit: सत्त्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रजः कर्मणि भारत | ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तमः प्रमादे सञ्जयत्युत ||
verses.transliteration: sattvaṁ sukhe sañjayati rajaḥ karmaṇi bhārata | jñānam āvṛtya tu tamaḥ pramāde sañjayaty uta ||
verses.translation: Sattva binds one to happiness, Rajas to action, and Tamas, obscuring knowledge, binds to negligence.
verses.explanation: Each Guna binds the soul differently: Sattva to joy, Rajas to work, and Tamas to ignorance.

verses.sanskrit: रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्त्वं भवति भारत | रजः सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तमः सत्त्वं रजस्तथा ||
verses.transliteration: rajas tamaś cābhibhūya sattvaṁ bhavati bhārata | rajaḥ sattvaṁ tamaś caiva tamaḥ sattvaṁ rajas tathā ||
verses.translation: Sometimes Sattva prevails over Rajas and Tamas, O Bharata; at other times Rajas dominates Sattva and Tamas, and at other times Tamas overcomes Sattva and Rajas.
verses.explanation: The Gunas are in constant flux, with one often overpowering the others in varying degrees.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते | ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्त्वमित्युत ||
verses.transliteration: sarva-dvāreṣu dehe 'smin prakāśa upajāyate | jñānaṁ yadā tadā vidyād vivṛddhaṁ sattvam ity uta ||
verses.translation: When light and knowledge radiate from all the gates of the body, then it may be known that Sattva is predominant.
verses.explanation: Signs of Sattva’s dominance include clarity, wisdom, and inner illumination.

verses.sanskrit: लोभः प्रवृत्तिरारम्भः कर्मणामशमः स्पृहा | राजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ ||
verses.transliteration: lobhaḥ pravṛttir ārambhaḥ karmaṇām aśamaḥ spṛhā | rājasy etāni jāyante vivṛddhe bharatarṣabha ||
verses.translation: Greed, activity, undertaking of actions, restlessness, and craving—these arise when Rajas is dominant, O Arjuna.
verses.explanation: Rajas manifests as greed, relentless action, and insatiable desires.

verses.sanskrit: अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च | तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन ||
verses.transliteration: aprakāśo 'pravṛttiś ca pramādo moha eva ca | tamasy etāni jāyante vivṛddhe kuru-nandana ||
verses.translation: Darkness, inertia, negligence, and delusion—these arise when Tamas is dominant, O Arjuna.
verses.explanation: Tamas leads to confusion, laziness, and a lack of purpose.

verses.sanskrit: यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् | तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते ||
verses.transliteration: yadā sattve pravṛddhe tu pralayaṁ yāti deha-bhṛt | tadottama-vidāṁ lokān amalān pratipadyate ||
verses.translation: When one dies while Sattva is predominant, one attains the pure worlds of the knowers of the Highest.
verses.explanation: Death in Sattva leads to higher, luminous realms.

verses.sanskrit: रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते | तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते ||
verses.transliteration: rajasi pralayaṁ gatvā karma-saṅgiṣu jāyate | tathā pralīnas tamasi mūḍha-yoniṣu jāyate ||
verses.translation: Dying in Rajas, one is reborn among those attached to action; dying in Tamas, one is born into deluded wombs.
verses.explanation: Rajas leads to rebirth among workaholics; Tamas leads to lower life forms.

verses.sanskrit: कर्मणः सुकृतस्याहुः सात्त्विकं निर्मलं फलम् | रजसस्तु फलं दुःखमज्ञानं तमसः फलम् ||
verses.transliteration: karmaṇaḥ sukṛtasy āhuḥ sāttvikaṁ nirmalaṁ phalam | rajajas tu phalaṁ duḥkham ajñānaṁ tamasaḥ phalam ||
verses.translation: The fruit of good action is pure and Sattvic; the fruit of Rajas is suffering; the fruit of Tamas is ignorance.
verses.explanation: Actions influenced by each Guna yield corresponding results.

verses.sanskrit: सत्त्वात्सञ्जायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च | प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च ||
verses.transliteration: sattvāt sañjāyate jñānaṁ rajaso lobha eva cha | pramāda-mohau tamaso bhavato 'jñānam eva cha ||
verses.translation: From Sattva arises wisdom, from Rajas greed, and from Tamas ignorance, delusion, and folly.
verses.explanation: Each Guna generates distinct psychological traits.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसाः | जघन्यगुणवृत्तिस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसाः ||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvaṁ gacchanti sattva-sthā madhye tiṣṭhanti rājasāḥ | jaghanya-guṇa-vṛtti-sthā adho gacchanti tāmasāḥ ||
verses.translation: Those established in Sattva rise upward; those in Rajas remain in the middle; those in Tamas sink downward.
verses.explanation: The Gunas determine the soul’s post-death trajectory.

verses.sanskrit: नान्यं गुणेभ्यः कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति | गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भावं सोऽधिगच्छति ||
verses.transliteration: nānyaṁ guṇebhyaḥ kartāraṁ yadā draṣṭānupaśyati | guṇebhyaś ca paraṁ vetti mad-bhāvaṁ so 'dhigacchati ||
verses.translation: When the seer perceives no agent other than the Gunas and knows That which is beyond the Gunas, he attains My nature.
verses.explanation: Realizing that the Gunas are the true actors (not the soul) and transcending them leads to divine union.

verses.sanskrit: गुणानेतानतीत्य त्रीन्देही देहसमुद्भवान् | जन्ममृत्युजरादुःखैर्विमुक्तोऽमृतमश्नुते ||
verses.transliteration: guṇān etān atītya trīn dehī deha-samudbhavān | janma-mṛtyu-jarā-duḥkhair vimukto 'mṛtam aśnute ||
verses.translation: When the embodied soul transcends these three Gunas arising from the body, it is freed from birth, death, old age, and sorrow, and attains immortality.
verses.explanation: Liberation comes from rising above the Gunas and realizing the eternal soul.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | कैर्लिङ्गैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो | किमाचारः कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते ||
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca | kair liṅgais trīn guṇān etān atīto bhavati prabho | kim ācāraḥ kathaṁ caitāṁs trīn guṇān ativartate ||
verses.translation: Arjuna said: By what signs is one known who has transcended the three Gunas, O Lord? What is his conduct, and how does he rise above them?
verses.explanation: Arjuna asks how to recognize and attain transcendence over the Gunas.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव | न द्वेष्टि सम्प्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्क्षति ||
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | prakāśaṁ ca pravṛttiṁ ca moham eva ca pāṇḍava | na dveṣṭi sampravṛttāni na nivṛttāni kāṅkṣati ||
verses.translation: The Blessed Lord said: He who hates not the presence of illumination (Sattva), activity (Rajas), or delusion (Tamas), nor longs for them when absent.
verses.explanation: The transcendent person remains equanimous toward the Gunas, neither craving nor rejecting them.

verses.sanskrit: उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते | गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येव योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते ||
verses.transliteration: udāsīna-vad āsīno guṇair yo na vicālyate | guṇā vartanta ity eva yo 'vatiṣṭhati neṅgate ||
verses.translation: He who, seated like a witness, is undisturbed by the Gunas, and who, knowing that the Gunas alone act, remains unshaken.
verses.explanation: Such a person observes the Gunas’ play without identifying with them.

verses.sanskrit: समदुःखसुखः स्वस्थः समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः | तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुतिः ||
verses.transliteration: sama-duḥkha-sukhaḥ svasthaḥ sama-loṣṭāśma-kāñcanaḥ | tulya-priyāpriyo dhīras tulya-nindātma-saṁstutiḥ ||
verses.translation: Alike in pleasure and pain, self-reliant, regarding a clod, a stone, and gold as equal, steady in wisdom, balanced in blame and praise.
verses.explanation: The liberated soul is equipoised, detached, and sees no difference between opposites.

verses.sanskrit: मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयोः | सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीतः स उच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: mānāpamānayos tulyas tulyo mitrāri-pakṣayoḥ | sarvārambha-parityāgī guṇātītaḥ sa ucyate ||
verses.translation: Equal in honor and dishonor, toward friends and foes alike, renouncing all undertakings—he is said to have transcended the Gunas.
verses.explanation: Beyond dualities, free from ego-driven initiatives, one becomes Gunatita (above the Gunas).

verses.sanskrit: मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते | स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ||
verses.transliteration: māṁ ca yo 'vyabhicāreṇa bhakti-yogena sevate | sa guṇān samatītyaitān brahma-bhūyāya kalpate ||
verses.translation: And he who serves Me with unswerving devotion, transcending the Gunas, becomes fit to realize Brahman (the Absolute).
verses.explanation: Devotion (Bhakti) is the ultimate path to transcend the Gunas and attain the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च | शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च ||
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇo hi pratiṣṭhāham amṛtasyāvyayasya ca | śāśvatasya ca dharmasya sukhasyaikāntikasya ca ||
verses.translation: For I am the abode of Brahman—the immortal, imperishable, eternal Dharma, and absolute bliss.
verses.explanation: Krishna declares Himself the foundation of the ultimate reality, embodying immortality and joy.
